loans.name: Cerelinda

texts.en:
Cerelinda works hard to support her family. Cerelinda is married and has a "trisikad" business in the Philippines.

Cerelinda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase tools and equipment. She has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Cerelinda would like to save enough so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment.

loans.name: Reylina

texts.en:
Reylina is 31 years old and married with six children. With four children in school, Reylina works very hard to provide for them.

Reylina runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy grocery items to sell. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snacks, noodles and other items. 

In the future Reylina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock and sell.

loans.name: Rosevelita

texts.en:
Rosevelita is married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosevelita is 48 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rosevelita has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy grocery items to sell.

Rosevelita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Rosevelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 44 years old and has five children. Ruth is married and has four children who are in school.

Ruth is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ruth requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ruth has been raising pigs for four years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Ruth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana works hard to support her family. Susana is married and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines.

Susana requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Susana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 61 years old and married with six children. 

Alicia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for seven years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Alicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Asuncion works hard to support her family. She has a business selling personal products in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Asuncion is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to customers.

Asuncion has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell to customers.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally is a widow. She has two daughters who are garment workers. She lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Phally is a corn farmer. Besides farming, she also sells mangoes. She hopes to continue her farming business, so she is asking for another loan of $700 to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm. She will also use part of the loan to purchase additional corn on contract from her fellow villagers for sale.

Photo: Phally and her brother.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm and buy additional corn on contract from her fellow villagers for sale.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 71 years old and married. Adelfa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

Adelfa has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from tailoring.  Adelfa aspires to save enough to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish business. Angelita has been in this business for 20 years. 
Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.   She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: To buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Lualhati

texts.en:
Lualhati is 42 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She wants to improve their computer shop to provide a better service for encoding and an internet cafe to their customers in the village. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy additional sets of computers with the excess to be used for their maintenance. Lualhati aims to increase her income to help her husband in financing the education of their children and to satisfy their daily needs. 

She hopes that the loan will help her to expand the business.She mentioned that hard work and strong determination are the key to make her dream into a reality.

loans.use: to buy additional sets of computers and to pay for their maintenance

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Anita works hard to support her family.  She has a banana business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and food vending. 

Anita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell in her business.  Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of bananas to sell

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is a 39 year-old married woman who has 2 children who are in school.  Bernadeth is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Bernadeth requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Bernadeth has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.  In the future, Bernadeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 43 years old and married, with 7 children.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

Elvie runs a charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of charcoal to sell.  Elvie has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 12 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.  Elvie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita, aged 42, is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Francis, a driver, and is the mother of three children; two are in high school and one in elementary. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. She is currently working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 

Juanita operates a market stall. She sells vegetables, raw products and condiments in the community market. She buys quantities of vegetables and other common items used in cooking and sells them per kilo or per piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 450 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more vegetable products and condiments to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Juanita dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business and to build her house in her province. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and condiments to expand her market stall's product inventory

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 43 years old and married with three children. He is grateful because through his patience and hard work he is able to meet the financial and basic needs of his family.

Robert's business is providing public motorcycle transport in the village where he lives. He works mornings and afternoons, transporting people from their village to market and school. He has his own customers whom he takes to and from school. Through this daily routine, he is able to earn 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. He uses this income for his family's daily needs, paying electricity bills and allowances for the children.

Robert would like to request a loan of 10,000 PHP so that he can buy wheels and sprockets for his motorcycle transport. Some of the money will be used to buy fertilizer for his rice farming business. He hopes that he can maintain his motorcycle transport and rice farming business.

loans.use: to purchase wheels and sprockets for his motorcycle and fertilizer for his rice farming business.

loans.name: Evonny

texts.en:
Evonny is 24 years old and married, with 2 children.  Evonny works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal & firewood business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal & firewood to sell.

Evonny has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running this business for 4 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.  Evonny aspires to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of charcoal & firewood to sell

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: Fortunata tiene 41 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Edgar de 40 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo al que Fortunata se dedica, es al cultivo de cacao y café. Todos los días, muy temprano, se dirige a su chacra  para poder labrar sus tierras, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga de la venta de su cosecha, dependerá mucho de la calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo han tenido sus frutos. Lleva 18 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras ya que tiene que estar cuidándose de lo toxico que son los productos químicos. Con el monto solicitado comprará más insecticidas naturales, ya que desea tener unos campos libres de plagas. Para más adelante, espera sembrar todas sus tierras, para obtener mejores ingresos. Este es el cuarto crédioto con MFP, manifiesta que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo y esta segura que contará una vez más con el apoyo de los finalistas. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Con el monto solicitado comprará sacos de abono natural.
texts.en:
Fortunata, 41, is a simple, hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her husband, Edgar, 40, and their three dear children for whom they want to provide the best quality of life.  Fortunata grows cocoa and coffee.  Every day, very early in the morning, she goes out to her plantation to work the fields because she knows the money she obtains at harvest time will depend on the quality of her crops.  

What she enjoys most about her work is the harvest season because she feels like after all the months of hard work she is able to reap the benefits.  She has been in this trade for 18 years and feels that the most difficult part of it is fumigating since she has to be very careful using the toxic products.  She plans to use the loan to buy natural insecticide to keep her land free of plagues.  In the future she hopes to grow crops on more of her land to increase her income.  This is her fourth loan through MFP.  She says the loan will help her get ahead in her work.  She is a much loved member of her communal bank since everyone says she is very supportive.  She also plans to use the loan to buy natural fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy sacks of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Candido

texts.en:
Candido is married with three children. He is 50 years old and lives in Compra, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Candido has a charcoal retail business. He has had this business for six years. Each month, he earns approximately 15000 Philippine pesos. Candido has been a member of PMPC for two years.

In the future, Candido hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase 50-100 sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 60 years old and married, with 4 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  Tita has a video games business in the Philippines. 

Tita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase tools and an additional unit of video games. Tita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future,  she would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase tools and additional unit of video games

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn is 42 years old and married, with 5 children.  Jerlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

Jerlyn has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from selling coconut wine and vinegar.  Jerlyn aspires to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eladio

texts.en:
Eladio is 51 years old and lives in Gatas, Kalawit, Zamboanga del Norte.  He is married, with 5 children.

To earn a living, Eladio has an eatery and water producer business. He earns about 20,000 each month doing this type of work. Eladio has requested a loan of 15,000 to purchase 2 sacks of rice, pork, chicken, beef and other food products.  Eladio became a member of PMPC this year.  In the future, Eladio would like to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of rice, pork, chicken, beef and others

location.town: Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is 45 years old and married, with 4 children.  She earns a living raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Lani is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Lani has been doing her pig fattening business for 6 years and also earns additional income from selling herbal oil.  She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Honorata de 48 años, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Alejandro de 54 años y sus 03 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Junto a su esposo, Honorata trabaja todos los días en sus tierras. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, pues ahí  siembra de todo un poco, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de calidad. Ella principalmente siembra plantas de cacao y café ya que estos son los productos que mejor precio tiene en los mercados.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos que pueden afectarlas, lo cual reduciría mucho sus ganancias. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, pues es ahí donde vende sus productos. Ya que las plagas aquejan sus sembríos, Honorata comprará con el crédito solicitado tramperas para combatir  los insectos quienes se apoderan de los frutos de las plantas. Para el bien de su futuro espera  cuidar con el mismo ímpetu sus parcelas. Este será su 17avo crédito de Honorata con MFP,  por tanto espera de un pequeño apoyo de los financistas para llevar consigo su propósito y por ello esta apta en devolver todo sus aportes puntualmente como en sus anteriores créditos, en su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria con el resto  de las socias. Con los 2,000 mil nuevos soles, comprará mallas que utilizará como trampas, para combatir con la plaga de insectos que asechan sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Honorata, 48, is from the city of Quimbiri.  She is a hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her husband, Alejandro, 54, and their three minor children for whom they want to provide the best quality of life.  Together with her husband, Honorata works every day on her land.  With much effort she has been able to make her land more productive.  She grows a little bit of everything and produces quality crops, the mains ones being cocoa and coffee since these command the highest price at market.

What she enjoys most about her work is caring for her crops against insect plagues since this would reduce profits.  She has been in this trade for 20 years and feels the hardest part of it is transporting the crops to the city of San Francisco which is where she sells them.  Since plagues are a menace to the crops, Honorata will use the loan to buy wire netting to combat the insects.  She plans to care for all of her cropland in the same way to protect her future.  This is her 17th loan through MFP and she is counting on lenders to help her meet her goal.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time as she has done with previous loans.  She is a very supportive member of her communal bank.  With this 2,000 PEN loan she will buy wire netting to combat the insect plagues threatening her crops.

loans.use: To buy several meters of wire netting.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.  Monina has been in this business for 25 years. She also earns  income from a coffee shop.  Monina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Indalicia

texts.es: Indalicia, de 39 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alberto de 41 años y sus 03 queridos hijos a quienes les brinda una educación adecuada. Indalicia se dedica a la venta de ropas y su puesto esta situado en el lugar más conocido dentro de la ciudad de Quimbiri. En este lugar atiende a todos sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y cortesía, quienes la visitan continuamente, debido a los novedosos modelos de ropa que trae personalmente desde la ciudad de Lima. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los atuendos que mejor les queden, ya que de esta manera se distrae un poco. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie todo el transcurso del día. Con el apoyo del crédito  comprará más ropas de Lima, de preferencia ropa de verano, ya que este tipo de ropa es la que más se vende en esta parte de la selva. Con el tiempo, desea situar su tienda en las galerías de la ciudad de San Francisco, en la cual pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este será su 17avo crédito y se siente muy contenta de saber que seguirá beneficiándose con el apoyo de los financistas, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo solicitado y esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente sus aportes programados. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa de Lima, de preferencia ropa de verano, ya que este tipo de ropa es la que más se vende en la selva.
texts.en:
Indalicia, 39, is a hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her husband, Alberto, 41, and their three dear children for whom they want to provide a good education.  Indalicia sells clothing and has a stall located in the best known area of the city of Quimbiri.  She attends to all her customers in a very kind and courteous manner.  They visit her frequently because of all the fashionable garments she brings personally from the city of Lima.  

What she enjoys most about her work is advising customers on what  flatter them most.  She has been in this trade for 15 years and feels the hardest part of it is having to stand up all day.  She will use the loan to buy clothing in Lima, especially summer apparel since this is what is most popular in this part of the jungle.  In the future she would like to open a shop in one of the shopping centers in the city of San Francisco, so she can give her customers better service.  This is her 17th loan and she is happy knowing that she has continued support from the lenders.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  She plans to use the 3,000 PEN loan to buy clothing in Lima.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 47 years old and married with 3 children.

Rosalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Rosalie has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and farming sugarcane.

Rosalie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is 45 years old and married with 3 children.

He earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Ruben is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for his pigs.

Ruben has been pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

He is working tirelessly toward the attainment of he dream: to save money to expand his business and send his children to college.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for his pigs

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 62 years old and married with 5 children. Adelaida works very hard to provide for them.

Adelaida runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Adelaida has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, canned goods, sugar, biscuits, shampoo, etc. 

In the future Adelaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 24 years old and married with 1 child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Grace has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines. Grace requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Grace has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fabric and other materials.

Teresita has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric and other materials

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia works hard to support her family. Arsenia is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Arsenia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca weaving.

Arsenia has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Arsenia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weaving

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva works hard to support her family. Eva is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Eva requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Eva has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Eva would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items groceries to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 53 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married, with 5 children.

Flordeliza works in the fish industry and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested loan to purchase 2 boxes of fish .
Flordeliza has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year. In the future, Flordeliza hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 boxes of fish

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She has a trisikad transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from sari-sari store. Elvira is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy equipment for her trisikad transport business.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her trisikad transport

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en: Gaudiosa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has run a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines for the last six years. She is seeking a loan for PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has done well thanks to her own efforts and the help she is receiving from NWTF, and dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
This is Girlie, 33, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Alfredo, a painter. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Girlie operates a peanut butter business.  She buys raw peanuts and other ingredients from the market, processes them, and then repacks them and sells them per piece to individuals and general store owners. Peanut butter is repacked in 250- and 500-gram plastic bottles.  Aside from this, she is also in direct selling, were she offers personal product items to her customers. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stock of raw ingredients used in her production. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Girlie dreams of growing her business and helping her family. She also hopes to have a store in the community market. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients needed in her peanut butter production.

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es: Jhonatan, de 22 años, es un joven campechano y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es forjarse un buen futuro y para ello trabaja muy duro. Jhonatan, se esmera por dar lo mejor de si mismo por lo cual trabaja arduamente sus tierras cultivados con plantas de cacao, café y plátanos, poseyendo en total con 02 hectáreas de terreno. Es conocedor del arduo trabajo que se realiza en el campo, donde viene trabajando 03 años en sus propias tierras, asimismo comenta que en tiempo de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de cosechar y trasladar los productos recolectados hasta cierto tramo para luego ser transportados a los centros de acopio. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo, porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas le resultan, así obteniendo buenas ganancias, cuenta que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque son meses donde abundan mayor cantidad de insectos perjudicando a sus sembríos. Con el crédito solicitado comprará sacos de abono para fertilizar sus tierras y posteriormente volverlas productivas. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo  para poder cumplir sus objetivos y por lo cual esta llano en cumplir con el pago de su cutoas puntualmente. Con el monto solicitado comprará, variedad de sacos de abono natural como, estiércol de animales.
texts.en: Jhonatan is 22 and a hard worker who lives with his parents and wants above all to carve out a prosperous future through his work. Jhonatan cultivates cacao, coffee and plantains on a plot of 2 hectares (about 5 acres).  He has labored on his own lands for 3 years and during harvest is helped by his sons and several day laborers that gather and transport the crops to reception centers.  He is pleased with the profits of his efforts, but still confronts hardships such as insect damage to his crops during winter months.  This is his sixth credit with MFP and he plans to use the loan to buy bags of organic fertilizer and manure to make his lands and crops more productive.  Jhonatan is committed to prompt repayment of the credit and is certain this will help him attain his objectives.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria is married with 3 children. Eleuteria is 63 years old and lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Eleuteria owns a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and has had this business for 30 years. Each month, she earns 5000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 8000 PHP to purchase products for her retail store.

Eleuteria has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year. In the future, Eleuteria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase products for her retail store.

location.town: La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 47 years of age and living with her partner in life. She has been running her motorcycle transport for eight years and it is the main source of income of the family. Though she has a separate house from her father, still she is responsible for his daily needs. 

Francisca has also been engaged in the hog and poultry raising business for two years. She is glad because though she is female still she proves to herself that she can drive and earn profit through her own motorcycle transport. She is grateful because she has her own customers that she fetches going to and from the school.

She would like to ask for an additional capital amount of P20,000 which will be used to purchase wheels for her motorcycle transport and sustain their daily needs. She hopes that she can improve her motorcycle transport and save money for her security purposes when she gets weak.

loans.use: to purchase wheels for her transportation business.

loans.name: Oyundorj

texts.en:
Oyundorj, 39 years old, is married and lives with his wife and three children in a house, in a ger district, in Hentii province of Mongolia. His eldest son is now a college student and the younger children are high school pupils. He started to craft wooden furniture from 1994 and collected money to buy his first car until 2000. Then he became a taxi driver until 2003, when he started to run a car repair service.

 He started this business with his own money and received a loan from XacBank in 1999. He used his loan properly and built a garage. His wife helps with the family business and manages the procurement of car spare parts. He is a hard working, diligent, and honest man who says "Although I didn't study engineering, I love to fix cars. I am planning to have a work station so that I can do my work indoors. I think this is the right time to take the opportunity. At the same time, my business is my sole income source and life guarantee." 

He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase car engines, tires and other spare parts.

loans.use: To purchase car engines, tires and other spare parts

loans.name: 23 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa has a retail business selling cloth. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Hoa is 41 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 23 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of six members. 
Hoa lives with her two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hoa has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Hoa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes to remodel her house, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and dressmaking supplies to resell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
To earn a living, Anita owns and manages a general store in the village while her husband cultivates their rice field. She is 29 years old and has one school-ages child. 

Despite the hardships of life, Anita works hard and strive for more. She aims to improve her general store to make it a stable source of income to support their family needs. She is asking for a loan of P 15,000 to buy bread, soft drinks, beverages, candies and frozen foods to sell in the village. She hopes that her patience and hard work will help her to achieve her business goal someday.

loans.use: to buy bread, soft drinks, beverages, candies and frozen foods to sell in the village.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 34 and is resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Leovigildo, her business partner, and is the mother of three children. Along with her husband, she manages the household and also operates a business. Mylene works hard to provide income for her family’s everyday expenses.

Mylene operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy small amounts of shampoo, cooking oil, or an egg. Mylene makes a profit by purchasing wholesale merchandise and selling smaller amounts. She also sells seasonal fruits in her store. Mylene’s store is located adjacent to her house and her customers are neighbors and local community members. She earns a minimum of 1,100 PHP daily. 

Mylene is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and fruits to expand her product inventory and continue operating her store. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business and hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery to better provide for the daily needs of her family. Mylene wants to work hard at her business to give her children a good and high quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share weekly stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. Groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and needed merchandise

loans.name: Zulhumor's Group

texts.en:
Zulhumor is the leader of this group. She is 30 and divorced and has a seven-year-old daughter who is studying at school. Zulhumor works as a cook in the local school and makes a monthly salary of 3,000 KGS. She also grows agricultural products to make additional money to meet her family’s needs. This year, she is cultivating 0.45 hectares of cotton. Zulhumor will sell some of her harvest at the market to earn an additional 2,000 KGS per month. 

Zulhumor is requesting a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers for growing cotton. In the future, she hopes to get a good harvest and she plans to use her profits to purchase household appliances to improve her living conditions.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: 24 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Loan is the leader of a three-member group, the 24 Điện Biên Solidarity Group. She is 40 years old and is married with one child. Loan lives with her family in in Thanh Hoa, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. For the past five years, Loan has operated a food stall where she sells pork pies and fermented pork rolls. Her main business challenge is the lack of capital. In 2009, Loan joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business and she has successfully repaid one previous loan. 

Loan is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls. With her profits, she hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, maintain a successful business, and be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls

loans.name: Enhbaayar

texts.en:
Enhbaayar is 27 years old and lives with his wife and a son in a ger, a Mongolian felt tent, in the Hentii province of Mongolia. His son will attend kindergarten this fall and his wife is an accountant at Baylag Hurah LLC. Enhbaayar started a transportation service in 2005. After saving his profits, he purchased a car in 2010 and became a taxi driver. Now, he runs a public transportation service in his local town. Enhbaayar is well-balanced in terms of providing income to his family and supporting his business. He is a hardworking, diligent, and honest man who says, "After I received my driver's license, I was in the public transportation business. Now my wife is pregnant and I cannot go far away from home for longer time. That is why I bought this small car. I fix this car by myself.”

Enhbaayar is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a car engine and other spare parts to maintain and repair his car.

loans.use: to purchase a car engine and spare parts

loans.name: 58 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Thúy is the leader of the four-member group, the 58 Điện Biên Solidarity Group. She is 52 years old and is married with two children. Thúy lives with her family in Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. For the past ten years, she has operated a food stall where she sells meat. Thúy’s main business challenge is the lack of capital. She joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business and has successfully repaid one previous loan.  

Thúy is requesting a loan to purchase meat to sell. With the profit from her loan, Thúy hopes to buy a motorbike and more land. She also hopes that her family will be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase meat to sell

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en: Guillerma is 49 years old, married and has four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has earned a living for the last 10 years by running a food-vending business. She is applying for a loan for PHP 13,000 to buy the ingredients she needs to make more food items to sell to her customers. Her goal is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.en: Gumercinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has earned a living for the last 10 years by running a shell-crafting business in the Philippines. She is applying for a loan for PHP 35,000 through NWTF to buy the materials she needs to make more items to sell to her customers. She supplements the income she earns from this business by also making furniture. She has done well thanks to her own efforts and the help from NWTF, and dreams of saving enough money to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for a shell-crafting business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace works hard to support her family. Grace is married and has a trisikad transport business in the Philippines.

Grace requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional trisikad.

Grace has been in this business for 3 years now, and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

In the future, Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional trisikad

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 41 years old and has 10 children. Helen is married and has 5 children who are in school.

Helen is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets,  and feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Helen has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, and feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lolit

texts.en:
Lolit works hard to support her family. Lolit is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lolit requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Lolit has been in this business for 6 years now, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

In the future, Lolit would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 60 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Leticia has a fish pond business in the Philippines. Leticia requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of feed for her fish.

Leticia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Leticia would like to save enough to provide a financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of feed for her fish

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has earned a living for the last six years by buying and selling fruits, especially coconuts, in the Philippines. She is applying for a loan for PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell to her customers. She supplements her income by also running a variety store on the side. Thanks to her own hard work and some help from NWTF, she has been a success and hopes to be able to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is married and has for the last two years earned a living by running a variety store in the Philippines. She also earns additional income on the side by selling food items. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF to buy more items to sell in her variety store. Her goal for the future is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 55 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Zosima has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Zosima requested a 15,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall. 

Zosima has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Zosima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Altantsetseg is 44, a seamstress, and lives only with her husband in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. Her husband is a driver and electrician. She has been running her clothes tailoring business since 1991 and she has been able to gain enough experience in this business. 

At first, she started her business with only one sewing-machine. But now she owns a full workshop. She has a plan to expand her business. Recently,  she needs more inventory of cloth materials because it is a busy season for her and she has a lot of orders. 

Therefore she is taking out a loan to purchase cloth materials to increase her  current business assets.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials to increase her business inventory.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is 55 years old and married with seven children. Claudia works very hard to provide for them. 

Claudia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase inventory. 

Claudia has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, drinks, and other groceries. 

Claudia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe works hard to support her family. Cleofe is married and has a business that sells personal products in the Philippines. 

Cleofe requested a 15,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more personal products to sell. 

Cleofe has been in this business for 12 years. 

Cleofe would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more personal products to sell

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Mr. Ganzorig is 31 and runs a taxi business in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He lives with only his wife and they own a small house in the rookery. His wife is pregnant and will deliver her baby soon. Ganzorig has been managing his taxi service business since 2007. His daily earning is not quite enough for their life. 

Currently, he wants to do renovations to his house before his baby’s birth. If he can repair his house, it will be in a better condition to raise their babies and more comfortable to live in. 

Ganzorig is taking a loan to purchase some building materials to  repair his old house.

loans.use: To purchase some building materials to repair his old house.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Maricar peddles a variety of fish like sardines & mackerel using her pedicab. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Maricar has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Maricar hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Elgie

texts.en:
Elgie works hard to support her family. Elgie is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. 

Elgie requested a 14,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca weaving. She has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income fR. charcoal sales. 

Elgie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weaving

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Mr. Gantulga is 35 years old and he lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He works as a driver in a company and doesn't earn enough to live on. In this year, his daughter will enter the kindergarten and his son goes to secondary school. 

Gantulga wants to start a new business of clothing sales at a shopping center called Sky Plaza, because he thinks that it will be more beneficial to his life and it must increase his monthly earnings. 

Therefore, at first, he needs to purchase and bring the commodities from China markets to sell to expand his current business assets. The loan he is taking out will be dedicated to purchasing the clothing goods to start his new clothes business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing goods to start his new clothes business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a resident and a farmer in Kisii area, South Rift, Kenya. He is aged 51 and has been in farming for 15 years, employing one farmhand and producing maize, beans, milk and bananas for the local market. He is married with five children, four of whom are schooling.

Robert has made a loan request amounting to 30,000 KES with Juhudi Kilimo to help him purchase and insure a dairy cow for his dairy farming business. He says the income from the dairy cow will help him comfortably educate his children. He is also planning to purchase a motorcycle to venture into the transport business and reduce the cost of his deliveries to the market. 

Robert however points out high costs of animal drugs and lack of organized markets for the farm produce as the impediments in farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Armie

texts.en:
Armie is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Armie has a shop that sells snacks like rice & cassava cakes. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan fof PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

Armie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Armie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.en:
Alfonsa works hard to support her family. Alfonsa is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment. 

Alfonsa has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Alfonsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas & coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari (general) store business in the Philippines. 

Andrea requested a 15,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Andrea would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: A very hard working food vendor in the Philippines, Editha is 42 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. In business for three years, Editha has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her enterprise. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en:
Rubie is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Rubie is providing "motorela" or "habal-habal" services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to pay for the gasoline for the services.

Rubie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rubie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for the gasoline to provide the services.

loans.name: Sherlyn

texts.en:
Sherlyn is 47 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City. She is married with 4 children.
 
To earn a living, Sherlyn has a business selling snacks.  She earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. Sheryln has requested a loan of 14,900  PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks business.

Sherlyn has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.  In the future, Sherlyn would like to own a  food stall.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks business.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Arlyn has a shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Arlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Arlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. She also earns income from a carenderia (local eatery) and her sari-sari store. In business for eight years, she is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase tools and equipment and to pay for labor on her tricycle sidecar.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her enterprises to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment and pay for labor on her tricycle sidecar.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana, de 34 años es una mujer joven y alegre con ganas de salir adelante, esta casada y vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas con quienes comparte la alegría de educarlos. El trabajo de Diana es muy tierno, tiene en su casa un sistema educativo no escolarizado con niños de dos años, ahí ella se encarga de cuidarlos y educarlos, este sistema es del estado pero no todo lo que le dan es suficiente, es por eso que ella invierte en la refacción y arreglo de su local para que sea seguro y poder así ayudar a las madres en el cuidado y enseñanza de sus niños. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene la oportunidad de poder ver crecer a los niños y darles un inicio de educación bueno, además le grada que por las tardes le da tiempo para poder realizar otras actividades como la venta de algunos productos por catalogo, espera mas adelante poder poner una bodega en su casa para que tenga otro ingreso extra con la ayuda de sus hijos. Este es el tercer préstamo entre la institución MFP y Diana, se siente muy cómoda con su grupo y espera poder seguir trabajando como hasta ahora de manera responsable y con seriedad de parte de todos. Con el monto solicitado de 800 soles, ella comprará materiales educativos, entre libros,cuadernos, lapices y colores, para trabajar con sus alumnos.
texts.en: Diana, is 34 and full of enthusiasm with a desire to get ahead.  She is married and lives in her own home with her husband and two daughters with whom she shares the joy of teaching them. Diana's work is very sweet; she maintains a pre-school creche in her home for children aged 2.  She takes care of them and helps educate them.  Though this pre-school is publically supported, she does not receive all the resources she needs, and she wishes to make repairs and improvements to the space used for educating children. What she loves about her job is having the opportunity to watch the children grow and give them a start to a good education. She has free time in the afternoons and sells items from catalogs.  One day Diana hopes to have a small store to sell basic items from her home.  This is Diana's third loan with MFP and she feels very comfortable with this group and hopes to continue working as she has done in a responsible and serious manner. The loan of 800 soles will be used to buy childrens' educational materials such as books, notebooks, colored and regular pencils, to work with her students.

loans.use: to buy educational materials such as books, notebooks, and colored and regular pencils

loans.name: Machell

texts.en:
Machell is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Machell has a shop that sells t-shirts, blouses, sandals & beauty products. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for 6,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy additional products from Natasha & Avon. 

Machell has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Machell hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products from Natasha & Avon

loans.name: Helenita

texts.en:
Helenita is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Helenita is making and selling coconut charcoal. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy coconut shells to make charcoal. 

Helenita has been a member of HSPFI  since 2010. In the future, Helenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells for making charcoal

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 65 years old and married with three children.

Emma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc to sell in her sari-sari store.

Emma has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and earns additional income from fishing and carinderia (restaurant).

Emma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Imee

texts.en:
Imee is 29 years old and still single. She has been running her motorcycle transport business for almost 10 years. 

She works hard because she wants to help her parents by providing for their daily needs. Being a female driver is quite difficult but still she proves to herself that she can make things possible. She enjoys her daily routine as the driver of a motorcycle taxi. 

Aside from transportation business, she also has a business selling vegetables. She has been selling different kinds of vegetables in her village. She would like to buy additional vegetables, but her capital is insufficient, so she is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP).

Part of the loan will be used to buy wheels for her motorcycle, and part will be used to buy vegetables such as such as string beans, squash, and eggplant.

She hopes that she can maintain her business to be able to sustain the needs of her parents.

loans.use: to buy wheels and vegetables to improve her retailing and transportation business

loans.name: Bonita

texts.en:
Bonita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

Bonita has a shop that sells beverages, snacks & candies. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy candies & snacks for resale. 

Bonita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Bonita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy candies & snacks for resale

loans.name: Adreak

texts.en:
Adreak is a thirty-four-year-old married man with four children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the family solely rests on him and his desire is to educate his children up to the university level. 

He has been selling coffee for six years and this business has enabled him to provide for the basic needs of his family. His major hardship is the high cost of fuel and his desire is to buy his own car for transporting coffee. Adreak needs the loan to buy coffee for resale.

loans.use: To buy coffee for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a widow with four children. 

Ma. Teresa peddles snacks like tapioca chips, banana chips, & takudo (taro rootlet) chips. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making chips to sell. 

Ma. Teresa is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Ma. Teresa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 58 years old and married with seven children.

Lucia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Lucia has borrowed and paid back 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 17 years and earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

Lucia aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 42 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Elsa works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa runs a business buying and selling used clothes in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

Elsa has been in this business for nine years.

In the future, Elsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 57 years old and married. She has seven children she supports with her husband. She was given a loan of  KES.45,000 which she invested in her business. She earns an income of 39,000 KES per month. She will use the loan to add more to her stock of cereals. 

The anticipated profit will be used to educate her children. This is her second loan with KADET Ltd., she paid her first loan successfully. 

Her hope for the future is to have a happy family.

loans.use: To add more stock of assorted cereals like maize, beans, and greengrams (mung beans)

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Elsa has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages, & canned goods. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy breads & biscuits for resale. 

Elsa is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy breads & biscuits for resale

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en: Anastacia, a 59-year-old married mother of four children, one of whom is in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. The operator of a tailoring business in the Philippines for 19 years, Anastacia has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more threads and fabrics for her enterprise. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more threads and fabrics for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Robilyn

texts.en:
Robilyn is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Robilyn has a shop that sells t-shirts, blouses, sandals, shoes & beauty products. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy additional stock from Natasha & Avon. 

Robilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Robilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock from Natasha & Avon

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Nancy has a shop that sells clothing like t-shirts, blouses, & underwear. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy more of the same type of clothing for resale.

Nancy has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Nancy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing like t-shirts & blouses for resale

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 48 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom attend school.  Merly buys and sells fermented shrimps in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She is  requesting a loan for 12,000 loan PHP through NWTF to buy additional stock of fermented shrimps to sell.  

In the future, Merly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of fermented shrimps to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a farmer in Kisii with one farmhand. She has been farming for 11 years and produces bananas, maize and cabbages which she sells to the local market. She gets additional income from her maize retail business. Josephine is married with 5 children, ages between 5 and 19 years old. 

Josephine has made a loan request of 40,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the income from the dairy business will help her educate her children and improve her family's living standards. She is focusing on buying two more dairy cows and establishing a grain processing business within the local market to supplement her farming income.

She laments about high input costs and poor markets for the farm produce.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is a 30-year-old married woman with 4 children and she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. Oliver has been operating a retail shop for 5 years. She started with 500,000 UGX and now has 3,500,000 UGX. Her hardship is bad debts and her vision is a wholesale business, a residential house, plus educating children. Oliver needs the loan to buy sodas, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: To buy sodas, sugar and soap

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a 52-year-old married woman with 4 children. The oldest child is 23 years old and the youngest is 13.

Merlyn is a farmer working in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice and corn crops for almost 25 years. Merlyn said she sells her harvest to rice traders in her town. She earns about 4,500 PHP per month farming.

Merlyn is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to gain more profit from her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Tessie has a shop that sells snacks like rice & cassava cakes. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks for sale.

Tessie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Tessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks for sale.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa, a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated an Internet cafe business in the Philippines for the past four years, is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase computer supplies for her enterprise. She also earns income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Melissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase computer supplies.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 51 years old, and she lives with her husband and her five children.Two of them are already married and two are working abroad. Her youngest is in the secondary level of education, while her husband is responsible for cultivating their rice farm. She has been engaged in vending vegetables and a hog raising business for two years.She glad because she earns about P3,000 monthly doing this kind of business. She uses her income in paying their electric bill, allowances for the children and for their daily needs.

Josefina would like to put up small stall in front of her house so that she will no longer offer her vegetables on a house to house basis. She is hoping that she can increase the profit she generates from the business she manages. To make her dreams fulfilled she is requesting a loan amounting to P5,000 to purchase vegetables such as squash, eggplant,  string beans and feed for the pigs. This amount could really help her a lot, most especially in attaining her dreams in life and business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables such as squash, eggplant,  string beans and feed for the pigs to be raised

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Violeta works hard to support her family. She has a fermented shrimp business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from rice retailing. Violeta is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients including shrimp and fish for her enterprise.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as shrimp and fish for her business.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Corazon has a shop that sells spices & food seasonings. She has had this business for 21 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy spices & food seasonings for sale.

Corazon has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Corazon hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices & food seasonings for sale.

loans.name: Deus

texts.en:
Deus is a 57-year-old married man with five children living in his own semi-permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda.

The responsibility to look after the family solely rests on him and his desire is to educate his children. He has been in the produce business for 12 years but the major challenge he faces is the effect of price fluctuations. His dream is to own a big store . 

Deus needs the loan to buy sacks of groundnuts for resale.

loans.use: To buy sacks of groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, a 39-year-old married mother of four children, two of whom are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For 15 years she has been selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines, and is now requesting a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy more produce to sell in her food stall.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business and continue to maintain her children in college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Melitona

texts.en:
Melitona, a 39-year-old married mother of four children, works hard to provide for her family. The operator of a variety store in the Philippines for the past six years, she has requested her fourth loan for PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional supplies to sell in her store. She also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Melitona aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies to sell in her store

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: El trabajo de Isabel consiste en la venta de helados y bebidas gaseosas, compra al por mayor y se encarga de venderlo por unidades en su casa, lleva realizando este trabajo ya mas de 4 años y esta contenta pues es rentable ya que siempre hay clientes y la ganancia se ve a diario, trabaja sola ya que no es necesario de tantas personas para realizar este trabajo, en algunas ocasiones le ayuda su esposo o su hija.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se relaja y aparte puede trabajar en otras actividades, ya que es promotora de un sistema de educación del estado llamado Piet -, espera poder continuar con lo que hace y en cuanto a su negocio aun no tiene planes a futuro ya que se siente tranquila por ahora.Este es el préstamo numero diez entre Isabel y la institución MFP, se siente cómoda en su grupo y espera poder seguir trabajando junto a ellas ya que la quieren mucho y es la presidenta del grupo, espera poder seguir trabajando junto a la institución que le da ese apoyo que tanto necesitan algunas emprendedoras como ella.Con el monto solicitado 1800 soles, ella comprara bebidas y helados para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en: Isabel sells ice cream and soft drinks, buying wholesale quantities and selling them retail from her home.  She has been selling these products for 4 years, and is pleased to see the business grow with daily profits.  She does not require much help to carry out these sales, but occasionally her husband or daughter assist her.  Her business is not demanding, and allows her to focus on other activities as well such as promoting "Piet" educational materials.  She is confident in the future of her sales and very content with her situation at present.  This will be Isabel's tenth loan with  MFP, and she feels very comfortable working with her colleagues there.  With a loan of 1800 soles, Isabel will buy additional stock of soft drinks and ice cream for re-sale.

loans.use: to buy drinks and ice cream to sustain her business

loans.name: Sinan

texts.en:
Sinan (in the photo) is a garment worker, while her husband is a construction worker. They live in a village fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They just have a yO. daughter. 

Sinan is applying for her second loan in the amount of US$ 500 in order to build a concrete  foundation for her house.

loans.use: To build a concrete foundation for her house.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
For the past five years Flor, a 32-year-old married mother of two children, has been earning a living farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She earns additional income from food vending.

Flor is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children.
 
Elvira has a shop that sells candies, biscuits and breads. She has had this business for one year. 

She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Elvira has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a 32-year-old married woman with four children, and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has had a cafe and bar business for a year. She started the business with 200,000 shillings and now has 1,500,000 shillings as her working capital. 

Her hardship is high prices of food and her vision is operating a five star hotel plus building commercial houses.

Annah needs the loan to buy drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy drinks.

loans.name: Thik

texts.en:
Thik, 43, has been married to his second wife since 2010. He has two daughters who are garment workers. They live in a village along National Road Number Four, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Thik is a motor taxi driver, while his wife is a garment worker. 

He is asking for his first loan of $1,000 in order to buy a motorcycle for his daughters to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his daughters to drive to work.

loans.name: Necefora

texts.en:
Necefora, a 50-year-old married mother of five children, one of whom is attending school, has been farming corn and sugarcane in the Philippines for 28 years now. Having borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business, she has requested a new loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Necefora would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pool table and mattresses for his guest house.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 35 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She has a business selling bread in Kator branch in South Sudan. She has been running this business for three years. Susan requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She can also earn income from selling groundnut paste. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her buy a plot (piece of land).

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 48 and married. He has six children and all are in school. He has been in farming for 10 years in his home area of Kisii, South Rift, Kenya. He has two farmhands who help him in producing maize and milk, which he sells to the local market.

Peter has made a loan request through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo for 25,000 KES to help him purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says his focus is to have two additional high grade dairy cows, and the profits will help him educate his children.

Peter says the costs of transportation and managing animal diseases are far too high. He remains grateful to Juhudi for partnering with small farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
