With the money from the loan she will hire temporary workers to make the harvest go faster. With time, she hopes to acquire new lands to increase her crops. 

This is her 9th loan with MFP and she hopes for all of your support. With the 3000 nuevos soles that she has requested, she will hire workers to help her with the harvest.

loans.use: to hire temporary workers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 40 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Elvis de 43 años y sus 02 queridos, a quienes desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. María mujer de arduas labores que cumplir, por ello se despierta muy temprano para preparar los alimentos para los miembros de su familia para luego dirigirse a abrir las puertas de su negocio en espera de sus primeros consumidores, La tienda de abarrotes de María es una de las más visitadas por el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras sabiendo de la gran variedad de productos de primera necesidad lo encontraran en la tienda de María. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dialogar con sus clientes, lleva 10 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie todo el transcurso del día. Con el apoyo del crédito solicitado comprará más provisiones para su tienda. Más adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en la más preferida y concurrida de su comunidad. Este será su segundo crédito y necesita el apoyo de los financistas para llevar consigo  su propósito, además se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por ser parte de su banco comunal. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mas mercaderías como sacos de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, conservas y entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Maria, 40, is a happy and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home together with her husband Elvis, 43, and their 2 dear children, to whom they want to give a better quality of life. Maria has a lot of hard work to do, so she gets up very early to make food for her family and then opens the doors to her business to await her first customers. Maria's grocery stO. is one of the most popular because of her charisma and friendliness that has made her preferred by many of her neighbors. They know that they will find everything they need at Maria's stO. because of her large variety of products. 

What she likes most about her job is chatting with her customers. She has been doing this for 10 years, and considers the most difficult aspect to be having to stay on her feet all day long. 

With the help of the requested loan she will buy mO. provisions for her stO.. Later she hopes that her business will grow and become the most popular in her community. This will be her 2nd loan and she needs the support of the lenders to move forward with her proposal. She promises to meet her payments punctually and is thankful to be part of her village bank. 

With the loan requested, she will buy mO. merchandise like sacks of rice, sugar, milk, noodles, canned goods and other products.

loans.use: to buy sacks for rice, sugar and noodles to stock her store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a determined person. She is 63 years old but despite her age, she still works hard to generate income and doesn't want to laze at home. Her husband works as a carpenter and Erlinda raises hogs for breeding and fattening. She sells them to butchers when the hogs are ready. She earns PHP 8,000 a month and uses it to pay for electric bills and for the education of her three children. 

The profits she earns are not enough to sustain the piglets she bought and that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for the hogs so they have good nutrition and ultimately sell at a higher cost. In the future, she also hopes to construct a more convenient pigpen.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for her hogs.

loans.name: Sur

texts.en: Sur, 54 years old, is a farmer who sells vegetables. Her income is $5 per day. She is a single mother with seven children, but only four live with her. Three of her children are working and earning $8 per day, and one more is studying. Every month, she has to spend $55 on food, $10 on electricity, $15 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a corn frying machine for her children. She has a plan to support her son to study Korean until he is able to work in Korea, because he could earn a better income there.

loans.use: To buy a corn frying machine for her children

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, natural de la ciudad de San Francisco de 43 años, es una mujer que siempre ha trabajado muy duro por sobre salir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo e hijos y lo que más desea es sacar profesional a sus hijos. La actividad a la que se dedica María es la venta de ropa, ella  todos los días atiende a muchos compradores, quienes sabiendo de la buena calidad y lo novedoso de las prendas que ella misma trae desde la ciudad de Lima, no dudan en comprarle más de 02 atuendos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es distraerse con cada uno de sus clientes a la vez aprovecha en aconsejar a sus compradores sobre las prendas que mejor las quedan, ya que así se gana la  confianza de cada uno de ellos, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer largas horas en espera de clientes. María agradece al apoyo solidario de los financistas ya que gracias al apoyo de ellos va progresando y obteniendo buenos bienestares. En adelante espera ampliar su tienda para poder mostrar mejor sus mercaderías. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP y por ello espera de su colaboración para poder comprar la mercadería a la vez se compromete pagar puntualmente sus cronogramas de pago ya que desea acceder a otros préstamos posteriormente. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa de la ciudad de Lima, para implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
43-year-old Maria is from the town of San Francisco.  She is a woman who has always worked very hard to do well in life.  She lives in her own home together with her husband and children.  What she most wants in life is to see her children become professionals.

Maria's business is selling clothes.  She serves many customers every day who are aware of the good quality, very latest clothes that she brings from the city of Lima and don't hesitate to buy more than two outfits from her.  What she most enjoys about her work is chatting with each of her customers and advising them on which clothes would suit them best as, this way, she gains their trust.  Maria has been in this business for 15 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to stay in her business for long hours waiting for customers.

Maria is grateful for the support of Kiva lenders since, thanks to their support, she is making progress and doing well.  In the future she hopes to expand her store so that she can better display her merchandise.  This will be her second loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can buy merchandise.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time and in accordance with the repayment schedule as she would like to access other loans in the future.  Maria will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to buy more clothes in the city of Lima so that she can better stock her sales location.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Lay, 50 years old, is a sugar palm maker with her husband. Their income is $4 per day. She has four children, one is studying and two are working and also earning $4 per day. Every month, she has to spend $41 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rent for their house, $3 on school fees, $10 on transportation costs, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her son to start a motor taxi service. In the future, she hopes her children can have their own careers to support themselves and she wants to be able to send her last child to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to start a motor taxi service

loans.name: Sreyee

texts.en:
Sreyee, 23 years old, is a tailor. She is living with her parent, and her income is $6 per day. Her parent is responsible for every expenses in the family; she only supports them with $50 per month. 

She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy fabric for making clothes to sell. This loan will help her be able to buy fabric and a sewing machine so that she can do her career well. In the future, she expects to have a tailoring shop by herself, so that she can support her parent well.

loans.use: To buy fabric for making clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, de 20 años, es una joven sencilla y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Deodono de de 25 años y su querida hija Lorena de 03 año, a quien desea brindar un mejor futuro. Maribel desde muy niña trabajaba en las tierras de sus padres, con sus ahorros acumulados mas la herencia que heredo de sus padres hoy tiene 02hectareas de terreno y los trabaja con mucho ahínco y ha logrado volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, cacao, café y palillo, productos que luego los lleva a vender hasta los centros de acopio situados en la ciudad de San Francisco, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, ya que se siente muy feliz haciéndolo, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los tendales por ello contrata jornaleros para que le apoyen en el carguío de sus productos. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más plantas de café para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos. Más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos, Por otro lado se compromete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en sus anteriores créditos. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos los integrantes son personas responsables. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará plantas de café para posteriormente injertarlos y sacar buena ventaja de sus frutos en menor tiempo.
texts.en:
20-year-old Maribel is an unassuming and hard-working young woman who lives in her parents' home together with her husband, 25-year-old Deodono, and her beloved 3-year-old daughter Lorena, who she would like to provide with a better future.

Maribel worked on her parents' land from a very young age.  With some savings that she had and an inheritance from her parents, she acquired two hectares of land which she works diligently and has made very productive.  Maribel grows cacao, coffee and turmeric which she takes to warehouse centers in the town of San Francisco and sells wholesale.  Her crops have provided her with the income she needs to support herself.

What Maribel most enjoys about her work is caring for her crops as she feels very happy doing this.  She has been in the business for 10 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her produce from the farm to the drying areas.  She employs laborers to support her in transporting her crops.

Maribel will use the loan she has requested to buy more coffee plants which she will then graft and benefit from their fruit.  In the future, she would like to buy more land so that she can increase her crops.  This will be her second loan from MFP and she hopes to receive a small loan so that she can achieve her goals.  For her part, she pledges once more to make her repayments on time as she did with her previous loan.

Maribel enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible people.  She will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to buy coffee plants to graft and benefit from their fruit in less time.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants

loans.name: Socheata

texts.en:
Socheata, 38 years old, is making brooms to sell. Her husband is a carpenter; their income is $6 per day. She has four children, who are 20, 13, 11, and 8 years old. Three of them are studying and one is working in the factory with $3 per day in income. 

Every month, she has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rental-house fees, $10 on school fees, $5 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a pair of cows to feed for doing farming in the rainy season. She expects to send her children to study and at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a pair of cows to feed for doing farming.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 31 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Esteban de 44 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Frank de 13 y Michelle de 06 años, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. En la ciudad  de Kimbiri (Pueblo perteneciente a la región del Cuzco. Uno de los lugares preferidos por los niños, es la tienda de golosinas de Nancy, todos los días ella abre su negocio desde muy temprano, para atender a todos sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ver la cara de felicidad de sus pequeños clientes cuando prueban sus deliciosas golosinas como manzanas, algodones, galletas y entre otros productos. Lleva 06 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie todo el transcurso del día en espera de clientes. Con el tiempo, desea mejorar las instalaciones de su tienda, para brindar un mejor servicio a sus compradores. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que contara con el apoyo de ustedes para concretar su propósito y por ello se compromete ser puntual con sus aportes de pago. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
31-year-old Nancy is an unassuming and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 44-year-old Esteban, and her two beloved children, 13-year-old Frank and 6-year-old Michelle, who are the main motivation behind all her hard work.

In the town of Kimbiri (a small town in Cusco region) one of the most popular places with the children is Nancy's sweet shop.  Every day she opens her business very early in the morning to serve all her customers.  What she most enjoys about her work is seeing the happy faces of her small customers when they try her delicious sweets such as candy apples (toffee apples), cotton candy (candy floss), cookies and other products.  She has been in this business for six years and considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to stay on her feet all day waiting for customers.  Over time, she would like to improve her store structurally so that she can provide her customers with a better service.

This is Nancy's eighth loan from MFP.  She knows that she will receive your support so that she can achieve her goal and, for this reason, she pledges to make her loan repayments on time.  She will use the 2,000 soles she has requested to buy more sweets to better stock her business.

loans.use: to buy more sweets

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en:
Ouk, 47, is a fruit seller. She is a single mother with two children who are 26 and 20 years old. Neither of her children are studying but work in the factory making $6 per day all together. Every month, she has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses.

She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a cow to raise and some fruit to sell. She has a plan to repair her house when she is able to make more income.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise and some fruit to sell

loans.name: Sokna

texts.en:
Sokna, 44, is a farmer. Her husband is a construction worker making $5 per day. She has three children: two are studying and one is working in a factory. 

Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $10 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for her son to commute to work. 

She expects to send the rest of her children to study in the university after they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to commute to work

loans.name: Luzcilda Miral Group

texts.en:
Luzcilda is married and has two children. She is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Luzcilda is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan of 14,999 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase 12 sacks of feed for her pigs. 

Luzcilda has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Luzcilda hopes to educate her children using the income generated from her business. 

Luzcilda is the leader of a three person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase 12 sacks of feed for her hogs

location.town: Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en:
Sreyneang, 57, is a grocer. Her husband is a priest, and their income is $3 per day. She has three children; none of them are studying but are instead working, making $3 per day each. 

Every month, she has to spend $75 on food, $5 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy grocery goods to sell, and to buy a motorbike for her son's commute to work. She hopes to have enough money to repair her house to be better than it is now.

loans.use: To buy groceries for resale, and to buy a motorbike for her son

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 28 years old and lives in Osukan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has two children. 

Mary Jane has a sari-sari (general) store business and earns approximately 4000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more products for her general store. 

Mary Jane has been a member of PMPC for over one year. In the future, Mary Jane hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store

loans.name: Rathanak

texts.en:
Rathanak is a housewife. Her husband is a Tok Tok (motorcycle taxi) driver who earns $7 per day. She has three children, two of whom are studying. Every month, she has to spend $75 on food, $3 on electricity, $5 on school fees, $15 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a motorbike to replace her husband's current motorbike because it is old and needs a lot of fixing. In the future, she wants to have a job so that she can help her husband by earning some money for supporting the family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband's taxi service

loans.name: Seim

texts.en:
Seim, 41, is working in massage shop. Her husband is working in the Ministry of Environment, their income is $10 per day. She has three children, two are studying and one is working in a hotel making $2.50 per day. Every month, she has to spend $75 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a motorbike for her son to use to travel to work. She wants to buy grocery goods for her daughter to sell at home after she finishes secondary school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son's commute to work

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 65 years old and lives in Canubay, Oroquieta City. She is widowed and has two children. 

To earn a living, Esmeralda has a business selling livestock. She earns about 2,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Esmeralda has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase livestock meat for her wholesale business. 

Esmeralda has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, Esmeralda would like to continue her business to supplement her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase livestock meat for her wholesale business

loans.name: Tout

texts.en:
Tout, 53, is a farmer with an income of $2 per day. She is a single mother with three children, all of whom are working and who receive a combined income of $15 per day. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $5 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her children's commute to work. In the future, she hopes to be able to help her children to have a small store to sell souvenirs at the temple.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children's commute work

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San, 56, is a fish seller who makes $7.50 per day. She is living with one niece. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy fish to sell. She wants to save up the income she gets from selling fish to repair her house and to buy a store in the market to sell fish.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny, 31 years old, is a farmer. Her husband is a gardener in a hotel. Their income is $9 per day. She has three children. Two are studying. 

Every month, she has to spend $80 on food, $10 on electricity, $30 on school fees, $15 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a pair of buffalo for plowing the field. 

In the future, she wants to send her children to study at the university of agriculture and will buy cattle for them to do farming.

loans.use: To buy a pair of buffalo.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Natividad works hard to support her family. 

Natividad requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Natividad has been in this business for 9 years.

Natividad would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married and has six children. She is 51 years old and lives in the Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Gloria has a piggery business to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan  of 5000 to purchase more pigs for her pig raising .

Gloria has been a member of PMPC for over a year. In the future, Gloria hopes to expand her business and have a garden to plant crops.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs for her pig raising

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther tiene 58 años, radica en su ciudad natal al lado de su esposo y una de sus hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 5 años de experiencia en ventas de comida que prepara en su misma casa  y de manera adicional también vende artículos de acuerdo a la temporada, permitiéndole ganar más dinero. Ella siempre esta en búsqueda de oportunidades de negocio así como procura buscar el lugar adecuado para venderlas. Durante estos años de  trabajo ha logrado ahorrar capital y ello le sirve para impulsar su iniciativa de negocio por lo que tiene planes de seguir creciendo e innovando. Es su crédito número 7 con MFP, en todo este tiempo de trabajo ha demostrado su liderazgo en el banco comunal. El dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en el negocio por el cual se ha asociado con un familiar, que es la venta de sombreros, por ello comprará este artículo en variedad.
texts.en:
58-year-old Esther lives in her home town together with her husband and one of her children.  She owns her own home.

Esther has more than five years experience selling food which she prepares in her home.  She also sells items according to the season.  This allows her to earn more money.  Esther is always looking for business opportunities and trying to find the right place to sell her goods.  Over the years, she has managed to save money which she uses to drive her business initiatives.  She has plans to continue growing and innovating.

This is Esther's seventh loan from MFP.  Over the years, she has demonstrated leadership within her community bank.  She will invest the money that she is requesting in a business that she has gone into with a family member (selling hats).  She will buy a range of these products.

loans.use: to buy more hats

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 48 years old and lives in Poblacion Sur, Maria, Siquijor Province. She is married and has two children.

Elsie sells fresh fish for a living. She has been doing this for 21 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to purchase more fish to sell.

Elsie has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for five months.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is widowed and has three children. She is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Manuela is a farmer who grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 50,000 to purchase fertilizer for the rice field. 

Manuela has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Manuela hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the rice field.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Virginia works hard to support her family.  She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish processing.  Virginia is borrowing PHP 19500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rosario Patria Group

texts.en:
Rosario is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business. 

Rosario is married and has two children. She is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Rosario is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

She has requested a loan for PHP 14,500 to purchase fertilizer for the corn.
 
Rosario has been a member of PMPC for five years. 

In the future, Rosario hopes to save money for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the corn.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda tiene 50 años de vida, radica en la ciudad de Huancayo, es viuda y vive con sus 4 hijos en una casa alquilada. Tiene más de 20 años de experiencia en la elaboración de tejidos de chompa a mano. Tras el fallecimiento de su esposo esta actividad se ha convertido en su unica fuente de ingreso, y por ello se ha intensificado más en este trabajo. Para lograr tejer la cantidad de prendas que necesita, debe contratar la mano de obra de otras señoras para optimizar su producción, esto le permite llevar una cantidad considerable de chompas a los comerciantes mayoristas a quienes le deja a crédito. Pese que es un riesgo toda la inversión que realiza, ha sabido salir adelante porque en todo este tiempo ha aprendido administrar adecuadamente sus ingresos y el deseo de incrementar su capital de trabajo para abastecer materiales básicos. Ella es nueva en el banco comunal que integra y fue invitada por sus vecinos  para que pueda mejorar su negocio, esta muy entusiasmada porque tendrá una experiencia vivida de un crédito grupal y por ello se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos agradeciendo por el voto de confianza hacia su persona. Con el dinero comprará más lanas de diversas calidades y colores.
texts.en: Nilda is 50 years old and lives in the city of Huancayo. She is a widow and lives in a rented house with her 4 children. She has more than 20 years experience in knitting sweaters by hand. With the death of her husband, knitting has become her sole source of income and so she has concentrated her efforts into the knitting business. In order to optimise production and knit the number of garments she needs, she must hire other women to help her. This provides her with a substantial number of sweaters to take to wholesalers on consignment. Despite putting her entire investment at risk, she has known how to get ahead because during this time she has learnt how to manage her income and balance it with a desire to increase her working capital in order to stock basic raw materials. She is new to the communal bank she is a member of and was invited to join by her neighbours so that she could improve her business. She is very excited as she will be able to experience group lending first hand. For this reason she is committed to being punctual with her repayments, grateful for the group's vote of confidence in her. With the loan, she is going to buy wool of different colours and varying quality.

loans.use: to buy wool of different colours and varying quality

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy works hard to support her family.  Daisy is married and has a fish and seaweeds business in the Philippines.

Daisy requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of fish and seaweed to sell.  Daisy has been in this business for 7 years now.  In the future, Daisy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 59 years old and married, with 11 children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines.

Leonila is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  Leonila has been farming rice for 38 years and also earns additional income from a fish pond business.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is 26 years old.  She is married and has 2 children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lorelie has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

Lorelie requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.  Lorelie has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Lorelie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 58 years old and married, with 9 children. With 2 children in school, Pacita works very hard to provide for them.  

Pacita runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock to sell in her sari-sari store.  Pacita has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries.  In the future, Pacita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Sreylak

texts.en: Sreylak is 39 years old and earns a living as a farmer. Her husband is a construction worker, and their combined income is $7 a day. She has three children, one of whom is still in school while the other two work in factories, earning about $4 a day each. Every month, she spends $30 on food, $3 on electricity, $7 on rent, $5 on school fees, $10 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She is applying for a loan for $1,000 to buy a motorbike for her husband to use when commuting to work. She will also use a portion of this loan to buy rice in bulk for sale later, because prices are going up steadily.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike and rice to resell.

loans.name: Jessie Malinao Group

texts.en: Jessie is 47 years old, married, has five children and lives in the Philippines. For the last 24 years, she has earned a living as a farmer, growing corn for resale. She is applying for a loan for PHP 14,900 to buy fertilizer to use on her next crop. She has been a member of PMPC for six years and hopes to send her children to school so that each of them can earn a degree. Jessie also leads a three-person loan group. Although the members of this group take out the loan together, each has her own business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for a farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for his herd of pigs.

loans.name: Placida

texts.es: Con 46 años, Placida ha forjado una sólida economía familiar, es casada y vive con la menor de sus hijas. Desde su juventud se dedica a elaborar bellos bordados de los trajes artesanales muy usados en su zona, con ayuda de una de sus hijas  y en la comodidad de su casa  trabajan para  combinar los colores de los hilos en cada  diseño de bordado y el buen acabado de su trabajo es muy apreciado por sus clientes. Asimismo realiza estos bordados para los comerciantes minorista que venden en un mercado local. Durante estos años de experiencia ha logrado tener mucha destreza en sus manos y puede avanzar más rápido en menos tiempo en cada bordado que realiza. Tiene muchas ganas de continuar adelante y de incrementar su producción. Desde que se informó de las condiciones de crédito tomo la decisión de trabajar con MFP por medio de los crédito grupales, en la actualidad esta es su quinta solicitud de crédito con una trayectoria limpia de ser una cliente puntual, considera que en todo este tiempo de trabajo ha sido fructífero porque aprovecho de manera adecuada  cada préstamo recibido. Con el dinero que solicita, comprará más materiales para sus bordados, como hilos de variados colores.
texts.en:
At 46 years old, Placida has built up solid family finances.  She is married and lives with the youngest of her daughters.  Since she was young, Placida has been beautifully embroidering the very popular hand-crafted outfits which are worn in her area.  She works with the help of one of her daughters.  They work in the comfort of their own home, combining the different colored threads in each embroidered design.  The finishing touches she makes to her outfits are very much appreciated by her customers.  Placida also embroiders outfits for retailers who sell them in a local market.

With their years of experience, Placida's hands are now very skillful and she is able to work more quickly and produce each piece of embroidery in less time.  She has a great desire to continue in her business and increase her production.  When she found out about MFP's loan terms, Placida took the decision to work with MFP through group loans.  She is currently requesting her fifth loan with a clean record as she is a punctual client.  She considers the time she has been working with MFP to have been fruitful because she has made the most of every loan she has received.  She will use the money she is requesting to buy more materials for her embroidery such as different colored threads.

loans.use: to buy threads in different colors

loans.name: Makara

texts.en: Makara is 29 years old and works in construction. His wife works in a factory and their combined income is $11 per day. He has two children who are four and two years old. Every month, he spends $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on rent, $5 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. He is applying for a loan for $1,200 to buy wood that he needs to repair his house. In the future, he would like to open a small beauty salon in his home where his wife could earn an income while also caring for their children.

loans.use: to buy wood to use to repair his house.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en: Florida is 60 years old and lives in Dapitan City with her husband and four children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by running a general store. She is applying for a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy additional items to sell to her customers. Florida has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in a general store.

loans.name: Mab

texts.en:
Mab is 42 years old and is a tok-tok driver who earns 10 USD a day. He lives with two of his siblings, who work in a factory and each earn 3 USD daily. Each month, he spends 30 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity, 15 USD on rent, 5 USD on transportation, and 10 USD on other expenses.  

Mab is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to buy a new tok-tok to replace his current one, which is old. In the future, he would like to be able to help his sister to buy a store in the market to sell fruit.

loans.use: to buy a new tok-tok

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is a farmer who works along with his wife. Together, they earn 3 USD each day. Sok has one son who works repairing motorbikes and earns a daily income of 10 USD. Each month, Sok spends 40 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity, 5 USD  on transportation, and 10 USD  on other expenses.

Sok is requesting an 800 USD loan to purchase motorbikes and parts for his son to resell and make a profit. In the future, he wants to continue to support his son’s career so that he has more motorbikes in his shop to sell.

loans.use: to buy motorbikes for his son to resell

loans.name: Benidecta

texts.en:
Benidecta is 59 years old and married with three children. She lives in Villaflor Oroquieta City, Philippines. For the past ten years, she has been a farmer who grows rice to earn a living. Benidecta has been a member of PMPC for six years.

Benidecta is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer for her rice field. In the future, she hopes to have a good rice harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch, who is 52 year old, works as a farmer along with her husband. Their income is 2 USD per day. The couple has two children, ages 22 and 25, who work in a factory and each earn 2 USD daily. Every month, Touch spends 40 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity, 10 USD on rent, 20 USD on transportation, and 20 USD on other expenses. 

Touch is requesting an 800 USD loan to buy a motorbike to commute to work. In the future, she plans to raise chickens at home because she is getting old and doesn’t have much energy for farming. Touch also wishes to send her children to study and learn a skill so they may have their own careers in the future.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more small animals such as pigs and sheep

loans.name: Sokreoun

texts.en:
Sokreoun is 29 years old and works as a garment factory worker. Her husband is a construction worker and their combined income is 4 USD per day. Sokreoun has two children, four and seven, and one of them is in school. Each month, she spends 40 USD on food, 10 USD on electricity, 10 USD on rent, 10 USD on school fees, 20 USD on transportation, and 15 USD on other expenses.  

Sokreoun is requesting a 500 USD loan to buy a motorbike to travel to work. In the future, she plans to raise chickens at home once she is able to save some money to buy feed. In the future, Sokreoun hopes to have more income to support her children’s studies through university.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Nova Niza

texts.en:
Nova Niza is 25 years old and is married with one child. She lives in Talairon, Oroquieta City. For the past four years, Nova Niza has run a shop where she sells a variety of goods such as candies, soft drinks, and bread. She has been a member of PMPC for ten years.  

Nova Niza is requesting a 3,000 PHP loan to purchase more merchandise for her general store. In the future, she hopes to own big grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase products for her general store

loans.name: Miguelita

texts.en:
Miguelita works hard to support her family.   She is a widow and has a food production business in the Philippines.

Miguelita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  Miguelita has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Miguelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Bunla

texts.en:
Bunla is 45 years old and is a fisherwoman. Her husband is a construction worker and their combined income is 7 USD per day. She has four children; three are studying and one is a company security guard who earns 4 USD daily. Every month, Bunla spends 25 USD on food, 6 USD on electricity, 10 USD on rent, 10 USD on school fees, and 20 USD on other expenses. 

Bunla is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to buy fishing equipment. In the future, she hopes that her children at least finish secondary school.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Reynelda

texts.en:
Reynelda is 42 years old and is married with five children. She lives in Dapitan City. For the past seven years, she has been working in the fish industry selling fish to earn a living. Reynelda has been a member of PMPC for five years.

Reynelda is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan to purchase fresh fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Pring

texts.en:
Pring is a farmer who works with his wife. Together, their income is 3 USD per day. He has three children who all work in a factory and each earns 3 USD daily. Every month, Pring spends 50 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity, 10 USD on rent, 20 USD on transportation, and 20 USD on other expenses.

Pring is requesting a 900 USD loan to purchase a motorbike to help his children travel to work. In the future, he wants to raise chickens to sell to earn additional income and support his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to help his children commute to work

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
Eddie is 53 years old and is married to a housekeeper. He has four children who are currently in school and hope to become professionals some day. Eddie is a farmer working in the Philippines, whose main crops are rice and corn. He also manages a hog-raising business. Eddie works hard and provides moral and financial support so that his children can finish their education through university and get married after graduation. 

Eddie is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional piglets to raise. His business goal is to improve his income from all of his businesses. Eddie will always support his children so that their goals become realities.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Hernina

texts.en:
Hernina is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Hernina has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.
Hernina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Hernina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino is married with 2 children. Avelino is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Avelino is a farmer and grows fruit-bearing trees to earn a living. He has been doing this for 18 years. He has requested a loan for 40,000 to purchase fertilizers for his farmland. 
Avelino has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Jhuven

texts.en:
Jhuven is 32 years old. He lives with his wife in his own home with his children. His home only has electricity. It is located in the Quirino province of Isabela. The people in this area farm, raise livestock and make handicrafts.

Jhuven's business is providing a public transport service, as he owns his own motorcycle. He works mornings and afternoons, transporting people who live in the small villages in the area. Sometimes he uses his motorcycle for delivering fish and vegetables. He has his own customer base and is able to cover his household expenses with the income that he makes.

Jhuven has requested a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos so he can do some maintenance work on his motorcycle and make some repairs to his home. Jhuven is very well known in his area because he is always looking out for his family's well-being with the goal of providing them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a tire and spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Everlita

texts.en: Everlita is a conscientious and dependable woman. She is married and praying that someday she will have her own child. She sells groceries at her own store in the center of her village. Her husband helps her in the store when she leaves to purchase groceries in the town market. Everlita has been managing her store for the last two years. She is always trying to maximize the profit from her business in order to improve living conditions for her family. Currently she is requesting a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos to purchase various grocery staples for her store. She hopes that lenders will support this loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snack foods, spices and canned goods

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda lives in Isabela. She is married and has one child. Erlinda has a business selling bananas, cabbages and tomatoes. She has been in this business for six months, and she works six days out of every week. Erlinda sells her products from home. 

Erlinda has requested a loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos, which she will use to buy more vegetables and fruits. The main business challenges for Erlinda include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start growing tomatoes and to own a delivery van. Erlinda lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense is feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, eggplants and pineapples.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 38, is married with one child. She lives in Comunal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Jocelyn sells different products in her grocery store to earn a living. She has had this business for five years and she earns 4,000 PHP a month. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more stocks of groceries and one sack of rice.

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for over a year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries and one sack of rice.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros, 47, has a grocery store. Her business arose as an alternative source of income for her home and she has now had it for over four years. Milagros has three grown children.

Most of her customers come to buy the various products she stocks, such as basic grains, snacks, soft drinks, juices, matches, salt and products for the home. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy the said merchandise.

Milagros dreams of continuing to grow her business and of increasing her inventory every day.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, drinks and spices.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, 34, lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Myrna has a retail shop selling snacks like banana cue and hot pancakes. She has had this business for three years. Myrna has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

She is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia, 57, is married and the mother of three children. She lives in the village of Ilagan in the province of Isabela. Lilia owns a small grocery store, which she wants to expand by purchasing a different variety of items from the ones she currently sells, like better quality coffee and a variety of cheese and snack foods. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP.

Her dream is to have a strong business that generates income so that she and her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy coffee, milk, canned goods and snack foods.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie, 47, is married with two children and lives in Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga. She sells groceries and dry goods to earn a living. She has had this business for 12 years and earns 18,000 PHP a month. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase 20 sacks of rice to sell.

Lenie has been a member of PMPC for half a year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of rice for resale.

loans.name: Margy

texts.en:
Margy is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Margy has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for her shop.

Margy is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Margy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is married and has 2 children. Roberto is 33 years old and lives in Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Roberto operates a bakery to earn a living. He had requested a loan for 20000 to purchase 3 sacks of flour, margarine, sugar, oil, yeast and other items.

Roberto has been a member of PMPC this year. In the future, Roberto hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of flour, margarine, sugar, oil yeast and other items.

loans.name: Nejane

texts.en:
Nejane  is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Nejane  has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages & mainly retailing dried fish per kilogram. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy dried fish to sell.

Nejane  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nejane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Jeogilyn

texts.en:
Jeogilyn is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Jeogilyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages & snacks. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Jeogilyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jeogilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Jenneth

texts.en:
Jenneth is married with 2 children. Jenneth is 28 years old and live in Siloy, Calamba.

Jenneth sells groceries and dry goods to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 35000 to purchase more dry goods to sell.
 
Jenneth has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to earn a living.

loans.name: Virginchita

texts.en: Virginchita is 53, married, and has four children. She lives in Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, and has a new business selling fruit such as apples and oranges. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy five boxes of oranges and five boxes of apples, and to pay to transport the boxes.  Virginchita has been a member of Kiva field partner PMPC for more than a year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of oranges and apples, and to pay to transport the boxes

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is 49 years old, is married, and has six children.  She has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy detergent, noodles, and canned goods to restock her store.  Merlinda is a new member of Kiva field partner HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy detergent, noodles, and canned goods

loans.name: Ramonito

texts.en: Ramonito is 40 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Poblacion, La Libertad, and makes a living as a motorcycle taxi driver. He has had this business for eight years. Each month, he earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). He plans to use this loan of 50,000 PHP to buy a new motorcycle. Ramonito has been a member of Kiva field partner PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita sells assorted groceries to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. She is 50 years old and lives in Libertad, Sapang Dalaga. Teresita is married with three children. Each month, she earns 6,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional grocery items for her business.

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve the general standard of living of her family with the income generated from her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries worth 25,000 Philippine pesos for her business.

loans.name: Magno

texts.en:
Magno lives in Dugayung, Amulung, together with his wife and three children. As head of the family, he raises crops to generate income. He goes in to the field every day, either sunny or rainy day season. He plants and harvests rice twice a year in May and November. He sells to traders in the village. He usually earns about 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each crop season. According to him, his profits are not enough to sustain his family and educate his children.

Magno needs to produce an abundant harvest to earn more income. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to have additional capital to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. With his perseverance and determination, the loans that will be given to him will help increase his yield. In the future, he hopes to earn consistent profits for home improvement.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is 62 years old and lives in Southern Poblacion, Plaridel. She is married with two children. To earn a living, Tabitha has a business selling longanisa (processed ground meat). She earns about 9,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Tabitha has a requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase pork and spices needed to make her product to sell. Tabitha has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase 25 kilos of pork and spices needed to make longanisa (processed ground meat).

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en:
Melecio is married with four children. Melecio is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Melecio is a farmer and raises hogs to earn a living. He has been doing this for six years. He has requested a loan for 50,000 pesos to purchase 20 sacks of feeds and other farm supplies. 

Melecio has been a member of PMPC for nine years.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sacks of feeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elueteria

texts.en:
Elueteria is 56 years old and lives in Magsaysay, Baliangao. She is married with three children. 

Elueteria has a timber sales business and earns approximately 16,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 50,000 PHP to purchase 50 bags of cement and other housing materials.
 
Elueteria has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.

loans.use: To purchase 50 bags of cement and other housing materials.

loans.name: Jesusa Saluta Group

texts.en:
Jesusa has a grocery store that sells soap, toothpaste, canned goods, noodles, etc. She has had this business for 15 years. Jesusa is 63 years old and lives in Camanse, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with eight children. 

Jesusa has been a member of PMPC for three years. She requested a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, Jesusa hopes to have a bigger grocery store and plenty of grocery goods to sell.

Jesusa is the leader of a three person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pipes, cement, nails and paint

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair pieces, hair oil, shampoo and beads.

loans.name: Muonga

texts.en:
Muyonga is a hardworking, 53-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with a 19-years-old child who is school-going. For the last three years, he has been rearing and selling poultry so as to provide for his family. He supplements this income from the earnings he makes from selling maize. In the next five years, he wants to have doubled his working capital so that he is able to expand his business. 

He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy chickens. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now able to keep and maintain book records for his business.

loans.use: to buy chickens .

loans.name: Eliodoro

texts.en:
Eliodoro is cheerful and a humble father. He was blessed with three children and a responsible wife who does daily household chores. Despite poverty, the couple still aspires to provide a progressive living for the family.

Eliodoro was given a rice field as an inheritance from his parents, and he has cultivated it for 10 years now. He raise crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for future sale. According to him, typhoons, drought, pests and snails affect his crop production.

He is now requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos to buy fertilizers and moluscicides used in farming. Moluscicides are chemicals used for the treatment of pest and snails. 

Eliodoro hopes to surpass all the trials he has been encountering in his farming business and produce a better yield to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and moluscicides (chemicals used for the treatment of pests and snails) to use in farming.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is an active 32-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with a 9-year-old child who is going to school. For the last 4 years, she has been selling fruits and vegetables so as to make ends meet. Previously she sold secondhand clothes. In the next 5 years, she wants to have expanded her business and started being a distributor. Her dream is to purchase a truck for easy transport of her products. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy paw paws and bananas. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy paw paws and bananas

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees is a very supportive lady by nature. She supports her family financially by selling bangles. She sells bangles to her community clients and also to different jewelry shops. She makes good sales every month which helps her manage the household expenses. She is the mother of one son, who is 15 years old and works for a transport firm. Unfortunately, she couldn’t educate him due to financial constraints and he had to start work as a teenager.

Bilqees has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her bangle-selling business. With the loan, she will buy bangles in larger quantity that will allow her to fulfill the clients' orders on time and make more income. Eid (a Muslim holiday) is near and this is a good time for earning more from her business. She is very hopeful that after the loan investment she will successfully be able to sell more and increase her profits. 

Bilqees is a regular Asasah client and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. In the photo, the lady slightly raising her hand is Bilqees.

loans.use: to buy bangles to sell.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
It is really hard to be the head of the family. "I have to work hard and always look for other sources of income aside from farming just to meet the needs of my family," Jesus says. He is 47 years old, married and blessed with nine children. Jesus and his wife are helping each other to support their family's needs, especially their children's needs for school. Five of his children are going to school, while one is working abroad as an OFW [Overseas Filipino Worker] and the others have temporarily stopped their studies due to lack of financial support.

Jesus still wishes to send his children to school to finish their studies. He will do everything and look for additional sources of income to meet their needs. Jesus wanted a loan to buy piglets to raise. He looks forward to the success of this business.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is 37 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They live in Dalaoig, Alcala, Cagayan. The primary source of income from the barrio (neighborhood) comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn grains for future sale. They earn a yield twice a year, during the months of May and November. As a determined father, Rolando cultivates rice and has been doing it for 10 years. In the last cropping season of May, he earned 20,000 Philippines pesos (P). Income generated from the crop went to school fees, allowances for the children, bills at home and to pay debts to the neighbors who helped them financially when an emergency arose.

Rolando is requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and moluscicides (chemicals for pests and snails) used in farming. This loan will be beneficial for him in making his crop more productive and generating more income. 

In the future, Rolando would like to achieve an abundant harvest to acquire more profits. He also wants to save money for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and moluscicides (chemicals for pests and snails) used in farming.

loans.name: Muhorro Tweimukye Group

texts.en: Damyano is a Ugandan male, aged 40 years, who needs a loan to buy maize and groundnuts to sell. He hails from the Kyenjojo district. He is a father of four children and has a wife who is a peasant in the same area. He lives in a semi-permanent house and dreams of educating his children and building a permanent house. He acquired his initial capital from cultivating maize and groundnuts on a small scale and his dream is to have a store of maize and groundnuts for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is married with three children. Marlyn is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Marlyn is a farmer and raises hogs to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan for 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase one chainsaw. 

Marlyn has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Marlyn hopes to improve the general living standards of her family from the income of her business.

loans.use: To purchase a chainsaw.

location.town: Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Edelyn has a retail shop that sells breads, snacks and biscuits. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy snacks to sell, like biscuits and candies.

Edelyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Edelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks to sell, like biscuits and candies.

loans.name: Salley

texts.en: Salley is 40 years old and a single mother of three children, ages 16-20 years, with no other dependents, living in Hoima, Uganda. She is the only one who earns income for the family, and her dream is to educate her children. She has been operating a retail shop for seven years. She started the business with 600,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) but now it has grown to 2,500,000 UGX. She faces the challenge of fluctuating prices and her dream is to run a wholesale business. Salley needs a loan to buy sugar, soap and soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Gemma has a retail shop that sells vegetables, seasonings and spices. She has had this business for years. She is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables and spices to sell. Gemma is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Munywambogo Abalema Tweyimukye Group

texts.en:
Benard is a Ugandan man, age 55, who needs a loan to prepare land for cultivation and plant maize. He is from the Kyenjojo district. Benard is a father of four children who are between the ages of 10 and 18. He dreams of building a good house and planting more than 10 acres of maize. 
\t
He is a member of the Munywambogo Abalema Teimukye Tukole group, where the members guarantee each other's loans.

loans.use: to prepare land for cultivation and plant maize.

loans.name: Mayleen

texts.en:
At her young age of 22, Mayleen has been blessed with two children ages three and four years. Mayleen's spouse is an institutional worker in a public hospital.

Mayleen is a hardworking mother and wants to help her husband with household expenses. She wakes up early and goes to the market to buy the supplies needed for her food-selling business. Then she starts preparing, cooking and selling street food such as fish, chicken and meat balls, hot dogs, and boiled eggs. She works from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. and at the same time cares for her children. With the income she generates from the business, she is able to pay electric bills and buy clothes for her children. 

Mayleen is asking for a loan of P11,000 to buy ingredients such as soy sauce, vinegar, and oil needed in cooking street foods and help boost her profit. 

Mayleen wants to educate her children and earn a degree for a brighter future someday.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as soy sauce, vinegar, and oil needed in cooking street foods.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 38 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 8-22 years.  Her family of 6 people lives in their own house in Hioma, Uganda. 

For 8 years she has been operating a textile shop. She started her business by selling used clothes, but now she sells new textiles in her own shop. She faces a challenge of customers who order and never return to pick up their orders. Her dream is to open another boutique since the business is profitable. 

Christine needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Butunduzi Bakyara Kweyombeka Group

texts.en:
Evas hails from the Kyenjojo district in Uganda. She is 40 years old and has been farming Irish potatoes for 5 years. Evas has 2 children and dreams of building a good house and having more than 5 acres of land covered with Irish potatoes. 	
She is a member of the Butunduzi Bakyara Kweyombeka group where the members guarantee each other's loans. Evas intends to use the loan to buy Irish potatoes for planting.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes for planting.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Analiza Teodora Group

texts.en:
Analiza is 49 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married with eight children. To earn a living, Analiza has a business selling fish, shrimp and crabs. She earns about 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Analiza has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase more fish, shrimp and crabs. In the future, Analiza would like to see her children finish a degree in school. 

Analiza has been a member of PMPC for two years. Analiza is the leader of a group with four members. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, shrimp and crabs to sell

loans.name: Airene

texts.en:
Airene is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Airene has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, biscuits and snacks.

Airene is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Airene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits and snacks

loans.name: Melinda Talisic Group

texts.en:
Melinda sells soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc., to earn a living. She has had this business for three years. She is married with three children. Melinda is 39 years old and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Each month, she earns 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase more soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc.  In the future, Melinda hopes to have a bigger store with more sales. 

Melinda has been a member of PMPC for five months.She is the leader of a 2 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.en:
Epifanio is 52 years of age and married to a hardworking woman. As the fruit of their love, Epifanio and his wife were blessed with eight children. Three of his children have finished their studies, and they are now working. Two did not finish their college but still they are working, and the rest are presently in school.

Epifanio is a farmer. Through planting and harvesting corn, he is able to send his children to school. He pays his children's school fees through the income he gains from farming. Epifanio admits that he has difficulties providing his children allowances for school – that’s why he has engaged himself in raising hogs for additional earnings.

Epifanio is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs. He will use the loan wisely to maintain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian has a sand and gravel business. She is 37 years old and widowed with one child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Vivian earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing her work. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase more sand and gravel. 

Vivian has been a member of PMPC for three months. In the future, Vivian hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sand and gravel

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Mary Grace has a retail shop that sells gasoline per liter. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy gallons of gasoline to sell.
Mary Grace is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Mary Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Vergilita Ramillete Group

texts.en:
Vergilita is 63 years old and lives in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children. 
Vergilita has a store that sells canned good such as noodles, soap and toothpaste. She has had this business for 30 years. She requested a loan of 14,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. Vergilita has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Vergilita hopes to save money for future emergencies.
Vergilita is the leader of a 2 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for sale

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Nida has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock to sell.
Nida is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy detergents, canned goods & snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Normumin

texts.ru: Нормумин проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 54 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам Нормумин занимается животноводством и одновременно растениеводством. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Кроме того при доме у него имеется участок земли, где он выращивает овощи. В этой области он уже 16 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Normumin lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 54 years old. He is married and has four children. His wife works in the communal farm. Normumin does animal husbandry and also agriculture. He makes a living by breeding large horned cattle. Besides that he has a plot of land by his home where he grows vegetables. He has been in this business for sixteen years. He is taking out the loan to buy large horned cattle.

loans.use: to buy large horned cattle

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
Abida has two sons. Both of them are illiterate because Abida couldn’t afford their education. The eldest one is 19 years old and a driver by profession, while the younger one is 16 years old and doesn’t do anything. Her husband has a tractor workshop. He offers tractor spare parts and engine repairing services to his clients. He is very expert in his work and his clients trust him due to the quality of his work. Abida works as a seamstress on a part-time basis. Her first priority is doing her household responsibilities as a housewife and afterward she works for her neighboring clients. 

Abida has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband because he wants to buy repairing tools to be able to provide better quality repairing services to his clients. Abida is hopeful that an investment will help her husband make his business better and provide better financial security for the family. She is a new client of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: to buy repairing tools

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is 41-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has 5 children aged 21, 17, 14, 9 and 4 years. He has 1 additional dependent, his niece, who lives with him. In 1993, Mohamed established his clothing business. He started his business because he believed this could earn him enough income to provide for his family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,050,000 every month. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans and now requires a new loan to buy additional clothing for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to improve his business and to educate his children to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for additional clothing materials for his business

loans.name: Rhea Amor

texts.en:
Rhea  is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Rhea  has a food shop that sells chicken, pork & hotdog kebabs. She has had this business for 1 year. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making kebabs.
Rhea  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rhea  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making kebabs

loans.name: Mira Fe

texts.en:
Mira Fe is 50 years old and lives in Lupagan,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. 
Mira Fe has a general store that sells different kinds of products. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan  to purchase  more stock for her general store .
Mira Fe has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, Mira Fe hopes to have a big shop.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Helen  Group

texts.en:
Helen is 32 years old, married with 2 children. She lives in the Philippines.
Helen raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for a year. She has requested a loan to purchase additional pigs. 
Helen has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Helen hopes to have a bigger cage for her pigs.

Helen is the leader of a 5 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs

loans.name: Riza Mae

texts.en:
Riza Mae is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Riza Mae has a retail shop that sells canned goods, breads & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She hasrequested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.
Riza Mae is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Riza Mae hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: This is 32 year-old Hawa. She is married, and has 5 children aged 16, 14, 12, 9, and 6. They are all in school. In 2006, Hawa established her food (Bulgur, garri and corn flour) business. She began her business to augment her husband’s effort to support their family and believed that the business can be her major source of income. Working 7 days a week, and 8 hours a day, she earns about 950,000 LE every month from this business. Hawa requires a loan in order to buy bulgur, garri and corn flour. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 LE. In the future, Hawa plans to  build a house, and to generate more capital to enable her to buy more stock.. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy garri, bulgur and corn flour.

loans.name: Krisna Cassinni

texts.en:
Krisna Cassinni is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Krisna Cassinni has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Krisna Cassinni is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Krisna Cassinni hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more jewelry for his business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Emma has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & rice per kilograms. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & rice per kilogram for sell.
Emma is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & rice per kilogram for sell

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is 31 years old and lives in Tacloban, Siquijor.  She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Rosalita has a business selling of fresh coconut juice.  She earns about PHP P 4,000.00 each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan to purchase fresh coconut juice to sell.

Rosalita has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 8 months.  In the future, Rosalita would like to gain more income from her business.

loans.use: To purchase fresh coconut Juice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To set up a photo studio

loans.name: Rommel

texts.en:
Rommel is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. 
Rommel has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for 5 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy breads, biscuits & canned goods.
Rommel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rommel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy breads, biscuits & canned goods

loans.name: Uguloy
